column5: Has anyone here ever fished this lake for Muskies? Just curious about how it was. Any luck? What lures? What time of the year? How big were your fish? Etc...

The Manitoba record Muskie comes out of Line lake 43 inches.I have Never fished it.From the Manitoba angling book there was some nice ones caught there last year mainly in august and September.FISH ON.

Haven't fished it for 5 years. Used to be good for walleyes and muskies. Pretty much an offroad excursion. Using #9 Rapalas, blue and white. Casting to the island or shore. Catch and release only. You will catch some nice eyes on the same lure. It's in the Duck Mountains across from Wellman Lake. When you hook your muskie, you better hang on. Caught 4 between 35 & 39 inches.

I see in the Manitoba Fishing and Hunting Adventures 2002 guide that they've stocked 200,000 fry walleys in the Lake. I hear it's a hike into the lake. How far in do you think it is and what kind of a trail? Thanks for the tips on the rapalas... my favorite fishing is casting crankbaits for walleyes.
bobby try posting here and you may get more infohttp://members3.boardhost.com/fishmanitoba/
Manitobawalleye - thanks for this info. I'll check that out.
